jobInfo.postDescription:
General Responsibilities: 
This Quality Assurance Engineering role is responsible for supporting the testing of products, systems, and applications across all phases of the Product Development Life Cycle (PDLC). This role specifically supports testing of firmware and software on wireless IoT products. 
In the early phases of PDLC, this role dwells into the technical aspects of hardware and firmware well before the integration begins and evaluates firmware readiness to ensure a smooth software/app integration. This role is responsible for the development of an acceptance test criteria for proprietary as well as third-party hardware and/or firmware before it gets entwined with our own internal PDLC for further development. This role also helps reproduce any concerns reported in the field – during alpha/beta programs, and all the way through commercial releases. Through continual examining of product requirement documents (PRDs) and UI specifications and with a thorough understanding of constantly improving the product architecture, this role is responsible for early identification of Hardware, Firmware and/or design challenges that may block specified UI functionality.

Specific Responsibilities:
•	Work as a Quality Assurance Engineer for testing firmware and software on IoT products, focusing on but not limited to Wi-Fi, ZigBee technologies. 
•	Configure necessary topologies and setup different types of test environment as needed for test execution. 
•	Report and follow up on defects logged in all system components.
•	Work with third party vendors or customers for debugging and tracking issues. 
•	Candidates must have good communication and executional skills.
•	Maintain a safe and clean work environment.
•	Perform all other duties as assigned and required.

Education and Experience Requirements
•	B.S. degree or equivalent in a technical field (e.g. EE, CS, CIS, ME, etc.)
•	Minimum 1 year of experience in a relevant QA or Test role.
•	Knowledge on Wi-Fi, ZigBee and other home networking technologies. Experience with a set of the following protocols: UPnP, DHCP, HTTP, SOAP, TCP/IP, Bonjour. 
•	Experience in testing iOS/Android Apps and debugging and exposure to iOS/Android tools like ADB, Android SDK, Xcode instruments.
•	Familiarity in executing automation tests.
•	Experience with Jira, Android/iOS App testing, Embedded Systems, Raspberry Pi, and networking technologies is a plus.
•	Highly motivated team-player that forms strong relationships with colleagues and has good interpersonal skills. Experience and willingness to working with remote teams.
•	Good verbal and written communication skills in English.
•	Experience with troubleshooting network issues, including, analysis of encrypted network packet captures (using tools like Wireshark, AirPcap, OmniPeek). ZigBee PCAP and analysis experience is a plus.
•	Experience with IoT product testing or development is a big plus.
